p: These are annual or perennial herbs, vines, shrubs, and trees distributed worldwide, being especially abundant in dry and hot regions such as Mediterranean areas. Additionally known as the mint family, the species from this group usually have square stems, opposite leaves, and aromatic essential oils. The evaporation of essential oils reduces water loss in xeric areas. Widely used as culinary and medicinal herbs, this family comprises around 7000 species grouped into more than 250 genera. Among the most popular genera are Thymus, Salvia, Mentha, Lavandula, and Origanum.
